title: Day Ahead: Top 3 Things to Watch
text:
© Reuters.

Investing.com - Here are the three things that could rock the markets tomorrow.

1. Packaging Chips

Two opposites in the stock world report earnings tomorrow.

Consumer staples stock ConAgra Foods (NYSE: ) will issue results before the bell, while tech stock Micron Technology (NASDAQ: ) will report postmarket.

Packaged food company ConAgra is expected to report a of 39 cents per share on sales of about $2.5 billion, according to forecasts compiled by Investing.com.

Last quarter the company reaffirmed guidance of 1% to 3% organic sales growth over the next three years.

Semiconductor company Micron (NASDAQ: ), a very good bellwether for the chip sector, weighs in after the bell.

Analysts are predicting a of 51 cents per share on revenue of about $4.6 billion.

S.G. Cowen boosted its target today on Micron (NASDAQ: ) to $46 from $38 ahead of earnings, citing favorable DRAM demand and NAND pricing, Briefing.com reported.

2. Housing First, GDP Second

Everybody sees GDP on their screens and it can get a bit hectic in the market, but tomorrow is just a revision of the previous numbers.

Housing should be continue to be the focus, given the spotlight on interest rates just now.

The National Association of Realtors will release its September measure of homes under contract to be sold at 10:00 AM ET (14:00 GMT).

On average, economists expect that rose 0.9% this month, rebounding from a 2.5% drop in August.

Second-quarter is expected to stay at an annual rate of 2% for the quarter.

3. So Much Fed Speak

The Fed members are busy this month and four more will speak tomorrow.

At 9:30 AM ET (13:30 GMT), Dallas Fed President will talk on trade and immigration.

At 10:00 AM ET, St. Louis Fed President with give opening remarks at a conference on minorities in banking.

San Francisco Fed President and Fed Vice Chairman will do the “Fed Listens” event at 11:45 AM ET.

And at 2:00 PM ET, Minneapolis Fed President will speak at a town hall.
description: Day Ahead: Top 3 Things to Watch
